} } } Length:: 0:49 MinsA year or so ago I had some vandalism trouble, including car damage and my house being egged. I thought it would be a good idea to get video camera to set up in the windows to record movement while I wasn't home. I tried the Uniden system that I bought at Walmart. While it is good for viewing and watching while turned on, with the included screen monitor, it wasn't easy to set up to record on the different sensitivity levels. You either recorded EVERYTHING for the allotted time, or very little. And I couldn't see anything that happened until I was home and reviewed recordings, such as they were. I now use it as a monitor for when my grandchild is over and supposed to be sleeping.I tried the Trivision NC 213WF, a higher end camera and was most interested in the wireless feature. I liked the promised ability to be able to view goings on while away from home. Below I've listed my findings on this camera.*The set up was easy, as long as you follow the included instruction guide. I wouldn't recommend just trying to plug in and expect results. Read the guide and follow the steps for the results you want. They are very clear.*The "AnyScene" app has to be downloaded and the camera synced to it so you can view remotely. This was a bit of a process for the wireless to pick up and accept. Follow the guide exactly and you won't mess it up.*Once the app is downloaded and your wireless accepts it, you can move the camera anywhere and plug it in.*I tested out how far I would be able to view remotely. I work 10 miles from home and can check from work and see what's going on. And I can clearly see the dog get on the couch or the cat moving around. I really like this. This works because of WIFI at home and work.* You can set up all different ways to record and set the time to show and date. I really liked that. Very easy. And the night vision was nice, as long as you turn off the LED. I have this camera placed right up to a window and if you don't turn the LED off, you will see nothing.*You can save images to a memory card or to record straight to your computer. Whatever is your preference. Very easy.*I did notice for the app, that it will crash. Not every time, but often enough to warrant mentioning. I did also notice that if this camera is moved from one location to another, the app will crash a few times and the camera will show up as "off line" . It has to be turned off and on a few times to get it to work. I've even had to shut my phone completely off a few times and turn it on to work. But that is the app. Not the camera. I have checked on my computer and it shows online, when the phone app doesn't.*The picture is on this camera is so clear it's like HD TV! Even in night vision. I would recommend this camera to anyone.Overall, I've been very pleased. Only drawback is the crashing app.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: ww
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a dog monitor. The picture is in color and very clear. The sound quality is surprisingly good. The night vision is really clear too. I have tried using it to view outside and whilst great in the day the night vision is a bit compromised with the reflection of the LED lights. But it's an indoor camera so no moans.The wireless setup was painless through my Netgear router. I'm not a technical idiot but certainly not a genius. I just followed the instructions and I was up and running in a couple of minutes.I had some trouble setting up the email alerts and after help from support I simply created a gmail address and mirrored the settings on their help document and it worked immediately. I found the support team to be helpful and responsive.Having the iPhone app is reason I bought this in the first place. It is simple to setup and provides excellent images and sound via wifi or 3G. It also works on the iPad although the image when x2 is a little grainy.By the way, the updated app "Anyscene" works perfectly on my iPhone and iPad. As recommended by Trivision, don't use the previous app version "P2Pcam264", which is unstable.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gabriel P.
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.......pros......simple set up...., perfect to keep an eye on pets or kids....i have one postioned viewing outdoors through a window, if the outside is lit up at night should be ok just turn off infared light or you will get glare....i started out with just 1 camera now i have 3.....cons....manuel is on disc and customer service needs to be emailed.....but everytime i emailed i got a response within the hour sometimes as early as 15 mins.....company cares about their customers......

Reviews.Title: Peace of mind builder
Reviews.Author: Ken Trammell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily to monitor my home thermostat while I am away as a "snow bird". I use my android or laptop to make sure my the temperature in my house is maintained and thus, the furnace is working well. It gives me a lot of peace of mind while I am traveling. It was easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Is this a scam?
Reviews.Author: Robert L Cox
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it advertises ability to install with iPad/iPhone. It says to download "Anyscene" from the app store. Tried that. Search of app store turns up nothing. I googled their website. Nothing there. Does not look like a working site. I have not yet tried installing via PC. Hope that works. But iPad install? No way.Okay turns out Anyscene is an iPhone only app so I finally downloaded it and was able to get camera working. Most features require a firmware update so will still need to use a PC. Their website has no support. I did not try emailing.I am holding at 1 star. I have four cameras working now but "live view" on the Apple app is poor. Biggest problem is that new camera right out of the box requires firmware update for any of the advanced features. Cannot even set date and time without it. I have read the 59 page user's manual on the CD that came in the box. No instructions on how to update the firmware except to contact their web site which doesn't exist. I tried browsing the CD through the software setup with no success. So as a basic camera, it works. But motion detection, email notification, etc. is unavailable without the firmware update.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jacky jane
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA REALLY WORKS GOOD THOUGH AT INSTALLATION I'M HAVING  A LITTLE HARD TIME (as I'm not well-verse in electronics items) BUT WHEN i USE THE INSTALLATION WIZARD THERE IT WORKS WELL.  THE CLARITY IS IMPRESSIVE WITH LIGHTS OR WITHOUT LIGHTS.  i WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYBODY.

Reviews.Title: Bad in low light.
Reviews.Author: STEVE KENNEDY
Reviews.Content: I'm disappointed that this camera is useless in low light.  I bought it as a raccoon watch.  I will have to install motion lights on my garden.

Reviews.Title: Plug and play?  No way!
Reviews.Author: Mark Downing
Reviews.Content: I very seldom become angry over a purchase, but this product simply did not perform as advertised.  I was looking for a camera to help verify pet sitter arrival while I am away.  The advertised features of "plug and play" and the ability to display the stream, wirelessly, on my iPad with an easy-to-use app from the App Store sounded like the perfect solution.Nothing was easy about the set-up of this item.  The microscopic type in the instruction manual makes little sense.  The app is only available for the iPhone.  This "wireless" device seems to require a direct ethernet cable connection to a router.  After figuring all of THAT out, additional firmware must be downloaded to make the thing work properly.  I suppose I may have been able to figure out how to apply a downloaded file to this camera, but I gave up after a number of trials and errors.The camera has been in my home for about two hours and it is already packed for return.  I sooo wanted this to work out of the box, but it simply didn't.  Not even close.  I continue to wonder if my pet-sitter is coming twice each day.

Reviews.Title: No Web Site
Reviews.Author: J. C. Kean "kean54"
Reviews.Content: The camera seems to work well.  However many of the features require a firmware update. One way you are instructed to do that is on their web site.  The web address is;[...].  That site is currently held by Go Daddy.An email to their tech support remains unanswered.  I worry that warranty and support does not exist.
